item.description:
NOTE:  There is limited parking down at the entrance on Holmes road, so please be prepared to park along the dirt road before getting to the "parking" area.

 

NOTE#2:  Given the 'slight nip in the air' this morning and the number of folks on the hike, we're going to be taking off no later than 10:05am this morning...


Our next hike is going to be in the Eastern Block of Nehantic State Forest.  About 3 miles, with minor some hills.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 


 


State Web Site:
http://www.ct.gov/dep/cwp/view.asp?A=2716&Q=325064

Trail Map:
http://www.ct.gov/dep/lib/dep/stateparks/maps/nehanticrt11.pdf

Directions off website:
The parking lot is at the west end of Holmes Rd in East Lyme. You can put this address in your GPS:

99 Holmes Rd, East Lyme, CT 06333

Follow the road to the end.


Otherwise from route 85, turn onto (go west on) Salem Turnpike (actually a well-hidden and very small street), then bear left onto Holmes Rd, the parking area is all the way at the end.

If you're going North on 85, it's a few streets on the left after the Dinosaur Museum ... if going South on 85 and get to the Dino museum, you've gone too far.

 

http://maps.google.com/maps?hl=en&q=41.438,-72.264

 

Lost?  Call or SMS Fred.  860-227-4027.
item.how_to_find_us: Fred will be there in his little blue Korean street-legal go-kart.
item.name: Eastern Block of Nehantic State Forest
